title: THE AUTHORITY OF THE BELIEVER
subtitle: UNDERSTANDING THE BELIEVER'S AUTHORITY
memory_verse: Then Jesus came to them and said, “All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to me.” - Matt. 28:18
objective: To examine the authority to be enjoyed by a Child of God
INTRODUCTION: Authority connotes the power to rule. Jesus Christ has been endowed with all powers that nothing can stand against which has literally been transferred to everyone that believes in Him. Every believer is therefore, expected to exercise the authority in Christ Jesus.
CONCLUSION: The authority we enjoy in Christ Jesus knows no bound as long as we remain steadfast and rooted in Him.

title: THE AUTHORITY OF THE BELIEVER
subtitle: SOURCE OF BELIEVER'S AUTHORITY
memory_verse: “I am the vine, ye are the branches: He that abideth in me, and I in him, the same bringeth forth much fruit: for without me ye can do nothing.” - John 15:5
objective: To reiterate Christ, the only source of our authority
INTRODUCTION: The growth and success of a believer is hinged on the understanding of the authority one has in Christ Jesus, continuous connection to the source is key, any disconnection from it will hinder us from manifesting our authority in Christ Jesus
Discussion_title: The believers stay connected to the source through
CONCLUSION: It is the desire of God that as He has endowed us with authority from above, we walk circumspectly in that reality according to His Word

title: THE AUTHORITY OF THE BELIEVER
subtitle: BELIEVER'S AUTHORITY MADE MANIFEST
memory_verse: “IThe Spirit of the Lord is upon me, because he hath anointed me to preach the gospel to the poor; he hath sent me to heal the brokenhearted, to preach deliverance to the captives, and recovering of sight to the blind, to set at liberty them that are bruised” - Luke 4:18
objective: OBJECTIVE: To examine what authority is in Christ Jesus
INTRODUCTION: As believers we are to live with the assurance and certainty of the authority we have both in- and through- our Lord, Jesus. Our authority is made manifest because we have been translated from the kingdom of darkness into the kingdom of his dear son. (Col 1:13)
Discussion_title: Our authority is made manifest through
CONCLUSION: A believer in Christ need not to be fearful, all authority has been given to our Lord Jesus Christ. As a believer in Christ, operating from this place of authority is of utmost importance for our everyday living.

title: THE AUTHORITY OF THE BELIEVER
subtitle: EXERCISING AUTHORITY AS A BELIEVER
memory_verse: “But to as many as did receive and welcome Him, He gave the authority to become the children of God that is, to those who believe in His name.” -John 1:12 (Amp)
objective: To highlight the practical aspects of exercising our God-given authority as believers.
INTRODUCTION: The spiritual authority of a believer is the right given to the believer to exercise (or to make use of) the indwelling power of God. We become a big threat to the devil when we know how powerful we are and acknowledge the authority we have in Christ Jesus
Discussion_title: How to exercise authority as believers

DISCUSSION.title: Interceding and standing in gap for others
Halt the work of the enemy

CONCLUSION: Walking in spiritual authority is knowing who we are in Christ and operating in that consciousness.

title: THE AUTHORITY OF THE BELIEVER
subtitle: MAINTAINING YOUR AUTHORITY AS A BELIEVER
memory_verse: “If you remain in me and my words remain in you, ask whatever you wish and it will be done - John 15:7
objective: To identify what is required to maintain our authority as believer
INTRODUCTION: Removing a species from its natural habitat can either lead to the death of the species or a stunted and non-profitable growth. For a species to perform to its full productivity, it is expected to be in a favourable habitat with all the essential resources for its growth and nourishment

DISCUSSION.title: Live a life fully sold out to Him and His course

CONCLUSION: Walking in spiritual authority is knowing who we are in Christ and operating in that consciousness.

title: THE INHERITANCE OF THE SAINT
subtitle: UNDERSTANDING THE ADOPTION AND THE BLESSINGS
memory_verse: “Having predestined us unto the adoption of children by Jesus Christ to Himself, according to the good pleasure of His will, to the praise of the glory of His grace, wherein He hath made us accepted in the Beloved” - Ephesians 1:5
objective: To understand what Spiritual Adoption is and the Blessings attached to being joint heir with Christ
INTRODUCTION: The adoption was designed as a master piece in God to reconciled men back to God so that what was lost in Adam can be found in the second and the last Adam, man was lost and a total separation happened in the Garden of Eden. The code word for adoption is salvation. Salvation is the means of rescuing a dying soul, a man who belong to another father unto the path of eternal and giving him a new Father which is God. We were sold out in the Garden of Eden but another transaction took place at Gethsemane and invariably completed at Golgotha, where it was finished
Discussion_title: Discuss in details what you understand by adoption and the blessings attached to it with the following scriptural references

DISCUSSION.title: The part of human in adoption
Being a member of the body

CONCLUSION: There is beauty in knowing that you are completely bought with a price which is the blood of Jesus Christ, which cleanse a man from every guilt of sin and it is that same blood that sealed the contract of our adoption, it is a movement from one cruel man to the courtyard of our God.

title: THE INHERITANCE OF THE SAINT
subtitle: PREDESTINED INHERITANCE AND APPROPRIATION
memory_verse: And he said unto him, Son, thou hath always with me, and all that I have is thine”- Luke 15:31
objective: To come into proper understanding of our inheritance and how to maximize it.
INTRODUCTION: There are a lot of realities and possibilities in Christ locked in a man in Christ, a Christian is like a goldmine but until the gold is discover and harnessed it remain just like every other piece of land but in the day that the gold is discovered, it commands attention from both far and near. Gold is discover because it has been deposited there, every man who come into Christ has an inheritance in Christ. The person of Christ is loaded with endless possibilities and He knows us before we come to Him. Everyone who ever comes to Christ have an allocation of resources in Him but often time it is left for them who know who they are in Christ to appropriate and stop living a beggarly life
Discussion_title: Discuss extensively what you understand with what predestined inheritance is and how to maximize it

DISCUSSION.title: *How do we Unlock it, the tools of engagement
Seeking first the kingdom of God
Add yours in light of the scripture

CONCLUSION: TThe inheritance of the saint is what everyone who is bought with a price, the blood of Jesus should look forward to seeing and must know how to appropriate it while on earth, having understand that the Will of the Father is done on earth as it is done in heaven.

title: THE INHERITANCE OF THE SAINT
subtitle: SON-SHIP, SAINTS, AND SPIRITUAL BLESSING
memory_verse: Blessed be the God and the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who hath blessed us with all spiritual blessings in heavenly places in Christ”. Ephesians 1:3
objective: To come into the understanding that only Sons can become Saint and Spiritual Blessings are meant for sons
INTRODUCTION: The farewell speech of Paul to the Ephesians church in the book of Act 20:32 shows the progression from brethren to having inheritance among them that are sanctified, therefore the bedrock of becoming saint is premised on son-ship and that hanged entirely on salvation. Salvation is the entrance into everything in the kingdom, and you might be a son who is not a saint, saint is a state where a man has been purged and be purified, the work of sanctification would have taken its course upon a man and that is what can qualified a man to share in the inheritance that are allotted for the saint. Being a saint is of higher dimension in God which implies that a man has been purged yet it all started from being a son. Note: The usage of son in this context is not a gender thing, it could represent both male and female.
Discussion_title: Discuss in details what you understand by the progression of sons to saint and the blessing attached to it.

DISCUSSION.title: *Who are the sons and what factor indicate progression?
Confession of sin and repentant of such
*What qualifies a man to becoming a saint
*What are the blessing attached to being a saint?

CONCLUSION: TThe inheritance of the saint is what everyone who is bought with a price, the blood of Jesus should look forward to seeing and must know how to appropriate it while on earth, having understand that the Will of the Father is done on earth as it is done in heaven.

title: THE INHERITANCE OF THE SAINT
subtitle: UNDERSTANDING AND APPROPRIATING SPIRITUAL BLESSINGS
memory_verse: “Now concerning Spiritual gifts, brethren, I would not have you ignorant” – 1Cor. 12:1
objective: To understand the nitty-gritty of spiritual blessings and how we can enter it
INTRODUCTION: God has blessed us with blessings, all spiritual blessings. Both the things that are eternal and the things that are temporal, why a good number of people are not entering into what God has prepare for them is because they lack the revelation of what has been prepared. We are not prepared to be stranded on this part of eternity, everything that we need to sojourn and emerge at the other side victoriously has been given, and we just need to be enlightened. The tense used by Apostle Paul in Ephesians 1:3 is third person present which is has, not will, it is what has been done. It is worth to note that all spiritual blessing is given by the Holy Ghost.
Discussion_title: Kindly discuss in details what you understand by spiritual blessings and how to tap into it.

DISCUSSION.title: Who is the source of Spiritual blessings?
How do we appropriate spiritual blessing?
What are hindrance to spiritual blessings?
How can we transfer Spiritual blessings?

CONCLUSION: Spiritual blessings are eternal thing and far greater than what money can buy, they are of eternal value and should be treated as something sacred which it is. The posture of heart to receiving and unlocking it is totally dependent on faith.

title: A GODLY TEENAGER
subtitle: A LIGHT IN THE WORLD
memory_verse: You are the light of the world. A city set on a hill cannot be hidden. Matt. 5:14
objective: To help teenagers shine the light in a dark world
INTRODUCTION: We find ourselves in the Gen-Z generation, where the world's values often conflict with biblical truth and God's expectations for us. The world system tends to define who we are, what we should expect from life, and most importantly, our purpose for existence. Is this really in tandem with God’s expectations from us as teenagers? No, today’s study shows us the best mirror image of who we are and what God expects from our lives even in such a time as this.

DISCUSSION.title: Do not live a life to regret later, some may be difficult to correct

CONCLUSION:
What are the differences between the Godly and Worldly systems?
What are of following the world system with examples?
What are the benefits of being a light and salt of the World?
Upholding godliness in an ungodly world is both a challenge and a calling. This is possible and we have been commissioned.

title: A GODLY TEENAGER
subtitle: A GODLY TEENAGER AT HOME
memory_verse: Children, obey your parents in the Lord, for this is right. Eph. 6:1
objective: To help teenagers shine the light in a dark world
INTRODUCTION: God instituted family, it is His idea and has a great expectation from every home. A Christian home consists of a godly father, godly mother and godly children. Godliness is not just in been goodly, religious, or merely identifying as a Christian. A godly teenager understands his or her own place in ensuring God’s will for his or her life and immediate family is established.
Discussion_title: Hierarchy in the home – Parents are God’s constituted authority

DISCUSSION.title: *Biblical examples of godly children in the home
Mention others – Isaac, Joseph, David, Samuel, Daniel and the three Hebrew boys
Blessing to both the family and the child
An intercessor - (prays for the parents and siblings)
*Biblical examples of ungodly children in the home
Mention others - Sons of Noah; Sons of Sceva.
God’s wrath or judgment on the family
Cut off the family from God’s plan
What are the things I need to repent from and the godly virtues I need to develop?

CONCLUSION: A godly teenager's presence contributes to a harmonious and Christ-centered home. This does not only benefit the family but ensures an all-round fulfilment for such a teenager.

title: A GODLY TEENAGER
subtitle: MAXIMIZING YOUR RELATIONSHIP - 1 SOCIAL LIFE, DATING ETCMAXIMIZING YOUR RELATIONSHIP - 1 SOCIAL LIFE, DATING ETC
memory_verse: “Do not be unequally yoked with unbelievers.” - 2 Cor. 6:14
objective: To help teenagers understand how to give their best and get the best from every relationship they are into
INTRODUCTION: The struggle to fit in is real, same as the struggle to be accepted. This is the reason many go into diverse kind of relationships, cycle of friends and form alliances. The good news is you are not alone in this, and God wants us to have the best of life experiences but in His own way.
Discussion_title: Answering the following questions are firstly important.

DISCUSSION.title: What is your understanding of relationship?
What is social life and is social life godly or ungodly?
God’s thought on dating (Lust vs love)
Can I have a social life and still be godly?
Discerning the impact of "worldly" influences, such as ungodly musical lyrics, dating, betting/gambling, pornography
Giving the best in your relationships

CONCLUSION: God's wisdom is essential for thriving in relationships and maintaining godliness in all our dealings.

title: A GODLY TEENAGER
subtitle: MAXIMIZING YOUR RELATIONSHIP-2: UNDERSTANDING PEER PRESSURE
memory_verse: Do not be deceived: 'Bad company ruins good morals. - 1 Corinthians 15:33
objective: To equip teenagers with insights to navigate and resist negative peer pressure
INTRODUCTION: Peer pressure is a potent force that can shape a teenager's choices and values. Whether we like it or not, our association, our friends, what we hear, what we do and what we see, influences our choices and decisions. Peer pressure is very real, what we do with it is what truly matters. Today’s study explores ways to handle and counteract the influence of peer pressure

DISCUSSION.title: Recognizing the forms of peer pressure
TName and identify negative forms of peer pressure common to you and then to others.

Are there positive forms of peer pressure?
If no, why? If yes, identify some.
The power of influence: Shaping character through associations
Be exemplary: Seek to influence rather than being influenced
Strategies to resist negative peer pressure
Consequences of submitting to peer pressure

CONCLUSION: A godly teenager learns to stand firm in their Christian values and are not negatively influenced by others' choices. They learn from positive influences and are not like the proverbial sheep that keep company with dogs.

title: RAISING GODLY FAMILY (SINGLES & ENGAGED)
subtitle: MARRIAGE: GOD’S IDEA
memory_verse: “And the Lord God said, It is not good that the man should be alone; I will make him an help meet for him” – Gen. 2:18
objective: To discuss the original essence of marriage relationship
INTRODUCTION: Marriage is the spiritual, legal, emotional and physical union of two people (male and female) who have agreed to live together as husband and wife till death do them part. It is the bedrock of a Godly family. Marriage was established in the Garden of Eden by God for the first man and the first woman He created. Although the concept and modalities of marriage has been presented in different ways by different groups, the Bible presents the original meaning of marriage, as intended by God its author.

DISCUSSION.title: Between humans, a single male and female
God inaugurated the very first marriage
*The purpose of God for marriage include

CONCLUSION: Marriage as intended by God is an extension of His creative purpose among the people on earth. A Godly home is that which understands and adopts the Biblical standard for marriage

title: RAISING GODLY FAMILY (SINGLES & ENGAGED)
subtitle: THREATS TO HAPPY MARRIAGE
memory_verse: “If the foundation be destroyed, what can the righteous do?” - Ps. 11:3
objective: To identify foundation factors that can challenge success in marital union
INTRODUCTION: Marriage as planned by God is expected to be enjoyed and not endured. Marriage is expected to be an experience of heaven on earth. Unfortunately, many marriages fall short of this expectation. Christian youth need to be aware of some fundamental pitfalls that could lead to failure in marriage, in order to prepare ahead not to fall into them.

DISCUSSION.title: Do not hide or be ignorant of the threats before entering into marriage
What has God said and/or still saying about the challenges?
Do you have room large enough to accommodate the challenges?
Are you both ready to adopt Biblical standard rather than the cultural and social ones?

CONCLUSION: Are you both ready to adopt Biblical standard rather than the cultural and social ones?

title: RAISING GODLY FAMILY (SINGLES & ENGAGED)
subtitle: MAKING MARITAL DECISION
memory_verse: For which of you, intending to build a tower, sitteth not down first, and counteth the cost, whether he have sufficient to finish it?”  - Luke 14:38
objective: To let the youths know that the choice of marital partner is a very serious decision to be made
INTRODUCTION: Decision on who would be one’s marital partner is a very important one which must not be trivialized. Youths who want to raise Godly families must approach this aspect of their life with all seriousness that it demands. In today’s study we shall study the Biblical steps towards making correct choice of marital partner.

DISCUSSION.title: Be intentional about your decision on marital partner
Reach out to God and lean on Him at every stage of decision making
Be sincere to be led of God and do not pretend to be
Be sensitive to the Holy Spirit's direction
Prayerfully subject your thought to very significant authority figures in your life
Obey the guidelines of your local church

CONCLUSION: Marriage is a life-long union; commencing the journey of marriage must be built upon a solid foundation.  God is the author of marriage and complete dependence on Him is a step towards making a successful home in the future.

title: RAISING GODLY FAMILY (SINGLES & ENGAGED)
subtitle: MAXIMIZING THE TIME OF COURTSHIP
memory_verse: Marriage is honourable in all, and the bed undefiled: but whoremongers and adulterers God will judge. - Heb. 13:4
objective: To highlight how to make the best of the courtship periode
INTRODUCTION: Courtship is the period in the life of a young man and young lady during which they both get committed to know each other in preparation for a future lifetime journey of marriage. It is the foundation upon which homes are built. Therefore, correctness of courtship goes a long way in determining the health of the home that will be built upon it later. It is therefore important to embrace a courtship that will bring about a happy marriage.

DISCUSSION.title: Christian courtship starts by seeking God's Will for the right person
It is a period to confirm your convictions
Be open about each other background and past lives
Pray together and study God's word together
Be involved in Kingdom's assignment together
Prayerfully and wisely plan for your wedding

CONCLUSION: Next to the decision to accept Jesus Christ as Lord and Savior comes the vital question of whom to marry. A wrong choice here can tragically wreck the believer's entire life. On the other hand, the right choice here can promise that the believer's future years will be a bit of heaven on earth. It is advisable to build the foundation of the future homes upon the Rock, Jesus' Christ.

title: A GODLY FAMILY - COUPLES
subtitle: RAISING A GODLY FAMILY
memory_verse: For I know him, that he will command his children and his household after him, and they shall keep the way of the LORD, to do justice and judgment; that the LORD may bring upon Abraham that which he hath spoken of him. - Gen. 18:19
objective: To understand the Biblical Meaning of a Godly Family
INTRODUCTION: A family is a group of people who are closely related to one another by blood, marriage or adoption. A Godly family have their faith and belief in God and worship Him together.

DISCUSSION.title: God instituted marriage and blessed such union to grow and multiply to become a family
Marriage, as ordained by God, is between a man and a woman. Both leave their father and mother to cleave together and become one, giving birth to a new family of their own
A Godly family has father, mother and children, who are bound and united together
They have a common belief and faith in the Lord Jesus Christ
A Godly home serve God together

A Godly family has Christ as the head of the home, the father submitting to the headship of Christ, the wife to the headship and authority of the husband and the children submitting to the authority of their parents -
A Godly family extends the light of Christ to all its extended family members

CONCLUSION: A Godly family is Christ centered, it is more than just going to church

title: A GODLY FAMILY - COUPLES
subtitle: HOW TO RAISE A GODLY FAMILY
memory_verse: Thus have we obeyed the voice of Jonadab the son of Rechab our father in all that he hath charged us, to drink no wine all our days, we, our wives, our sons, nor our daughters” Jer. 35:8
objective: To know ways of bringing up a Godly family
INTRODUCTION: Every good family seen in the society did not just appear nor made in a day. There are efforts, sacrifices, sowing being done into any good thing that exists, including a Godly family.

DISCUSSION.title: As good role models, parents are to lay good examples for others to follow. Leading and teaching by examples is very effective
Read and study God's word together
Observe family devotion together regularly, to nurture the Godly seeds under them with balanced meal from God's word
Pray together, "A family that prays together, stays together
Teach good values, morals and how to live a righteous life in a corrupt environment
Go to church and serve God together

CONCLUSION: A Godly family is raised intentionally, it doesn't just happen.

title: A GODLY FAMILY - COUPLES
subtitle: INDICES OF A GODLY FAMILY
memory_verse: My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me' - John 10:27
objective: To highlight pointers or indices to look out for in a Godly family
INTRODUCTION: Many homes are religious but not godly. Products, fruits seen from homes indicate what type of family they are from. There are certain criteria seen in any family that show whether such families are Godly or not.

DISCUSSION.title: A Godly home has Jesus as their Lord and savior
The wife and the children submits to the leadership of the father and the children obey parental authority
In a Godly home, there's love and respect for one another
All live in the fear of God, doing that which is right and Godly
A Godly family stays United despite all storms of life
A Godly family lives the life of Christ and shows the way of Christ to others

CONCLUSION: You shall know them by their fruits. Our acts, ways, mannerisms speak louder than words.

title: GODLY FAMILY - COUPLES
subtitle: BENEFITS OF A GODLY FAMILY
memory_verse: “And I will make thee exceeding fruitful, and I will make nations of thee, and kings shall come out of thee.”  Gen 17:6
objective: To know the blessings of raising a Godly family
INTRODUCTION: For every action or inaction, there's always a consequence. Raising a Godly family comes with efforts put in place. Such efforts are rewarded with blessings as we shall be considering in this study

DISCUSSION.title: A Godly family enjoy all round prosperity
Peace in the home, peace in the society
We become kings and priest, who shall reign with Him

CONCLUSION: There's joy, peace, rest in having a Godly family. All men shall call you blessed and the heaven shall rejoice over such a home with singing.

title: SOUL WINNING
subtitle: UNDERSTANDING STRATEGIES FOR SOUL WINNING
memory_verse: Go ye therefore, and teach all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost - Matt. 28:19
objective:
(i) To examine the meaning of soul winning.
(ii) To examining the effective strategies to enhance soul winning.
INTRODUCTION: Soul winning involves reaching out to those around you who may not know Jesus as their personal Lord and Savior. (Matt 28:19-20). It is important to commit to heart that soul-winning is not just a task for pastors, ordained leaders or evangelists, but it's a responsibility for every Christian. We must do the work of Him who sent us to rescue sinners from the danger or wrath that is to come.
Discussion_title: Effective strategies for soul-winning

DISCUSSION.title: Praying for the world of sinner
Online preaching such as Twitter, YouTube, IG, Facebook

CONCLUSION: Until believers win souls for Christ and those souls reciprocate the love to other sinners, our strategies for soul winning cannot be said to effective.

title: SOUL WINNING
subtitle: APPROACHES TO EFFECTIVE SOUL WINNING
memory_verse: “To the weak became I as weak, that I might gain the weak: I am made all things to all [men], that I might by all means save some.” - 1 Cor. 9:22.
objective: To examine approaches to effective Soul winning
INTRODUCTION: Soul winning is the major purpose of the believer as commissioned in Matt. 28:19-20. Hence our responsibility as Christ’ believers is to learn and adopt effective ways to carry out this mandate.
Discussion_title: Effective strategies for soul-winning

DISCUSSION.title: Know the gospel and be intentional in preaching the Gospel. [the Romans road to salvation

CONCLUSION: Actualizing effectiveness in Soul winning is dependent on our willingness and total dependence on God who commissions us, then constantly asking Him for guidance and empowerment to carry His Message with Power and Conviction.

title: SOUL WINNING
subtitle: OVERCOMING CHALLENGES IN SOUL WINNING
memory_verse: “Therefore do not be ashamed of the testimony about our Lord, nor of me his prisoner, but share in suffering for the gospel by the power of God.” 2Tim1:8.
objective: To identifying the challenges that can be encountered during soul winning and ways to overcome them.
INTRODUCTION: Soul winning is the primary assignment of every believer. It is a compulsory task that must be achieved by every genuine Christian. There are, however, some challenges that may be faced during the process. How these challenges must be surmounted to populate the kingdom of God is the focus of this study.

DISCUSSION.title: Shame of being associated with Christ

CONCLUSION: It is never too late to be a soul-winner. You must trust God to help you to overcome these hindrances in order to fulfil the assignment the Lord has entrusted to us.

title: SOUL WINNING
subtitle: REWARDS OF SOUL WINNING
memory_verse: “Now he that planteth and he that watereth are one: and every man shall receive his own reward according to his own labor.” 1Cor. 3:8
objective: To highlight the benefits and reward of soul winning
INTRODUCTION: As believers, we have been saved, not just for ourselves, but to arise for the salvation of others. Our mission of reconciling men to God has great rewards here on earth and in our glorious home above.
CONCLUSION: Soul winning is the Father's business. If you go about the Father's business and do your part to make it prosper, He would reward you. God is a good rewarder who pays each of His laborers accordingly. He owes no man anything, and He will not start now.

title: THE KINGDOM OF GOD
subtitle: THE CONCEPT OF THE KINGDOM OF GOD
memory_verse: “For the kingdom of God is not a matter of eating and drinking but of righteousness, peace and joy in the Holy Spirit.” - Rom. 14:17
objective: To explore the attributes that define the nature of God's Kingdom
INTRODUCTION: The kingdom is governed by the principles of God as laid out in scriptures. Believers have been redeemed from sin to become partakers of this kingdom.
Discussion_title: Attributes of the kingdom of God.
CONCLUSION: Believers have a responsibility to live in conformity with the kingdom standard.

title: THE KINGDOM OF GOD
subtitle: CHARACTERISTICS OF THE KINGDOM OF GOD
memory_verse: “nd said, Verily I say unto you, except ye be converted, and become as little children, ye shall not enter into the kingdom of heaven.” - Matt. 18:3
objective: To examine the requirements of citizens of God's Kingdom
INTRODUCTION: Every nation have requirements for citizenship. All who would become citizens of God's kingdom must satisfy the requirements laid out in the scriptures.
Discussion_title: Requirements for kingdom citizenship:

DISCUSSION.title: Do the Will of the Father in heaven

CONCLUSION: Becoming a citizen of the kingdom requires that believers depart from sin and live as God desires.

title: THE KINGDOM OF GOD
subtitle: EXPANDING GOD'S KINGDOM
memory_verse: “And Jesus went about all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues, and healing every sickness and every disease among people.” - Matt. 9:35.
objective: To show ways the Kingdom of God can be sought and expanded
INTRODUCTION:
We expand God's kingdom through our light, life, behaviour and relationships with people around us. We allow the Holy Spirit to draw them to Jesus through us.
Isaiah 2:2 KJV
[2] And it shall come to pass in the last days, that the mountain of the LORD's house shall be established in the top of the mountains, and shall be exalted above the hills; and all nations shall flow unto it. Zechariah 1:17 KJV
[17] Cry yet, saying, Thus saith the LORD of hosts; My cities through prosperity shall yet be spread abroad; and the LORD shall yet comfort Zion, and shall yet choose Jerusalem.
Discussion_title: Biblical strategies to expand God's kingdom

DISCUSSION.title: Press in to the kingdom of God

CONCLUSION: Everything needed to expand God's kingdom have been made available to us to utilize. Therefore, we must not fail to expand the kingdom of God.

title: THE KINGDOM OF GOD
subtitle: KINGDOM LIFESTYLE
memory_verse: “After this manner therefore pray ye: Our Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy name. Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done in earth, as [it is] in heaven.” - Matt. 6:9-10
objective: To examine the requirements of citizens of God's Kingdom.
INTRODUCTION: Kingdom lifestyle is a life governed by godly principles and laws. We are ambassadors of the kingdom on earth and so must live as God expects us to.
Discussion_title: The lifestyle of kingdom citizens

DISCUSSION.title: Absolute surrender: this involves giving up our will to accept His own
Full and led by the Spirit
Consecration: Jesus is the perfect example of consecration

CONCLUSION: Living the Kingdom lifestyle requires that we become ardent imitators of Jesus Christ. Study and learn of Him for clarity.

title: PRAYING EFFECTIVELY
subtitle: WHAT IS PRAYER?
memory_verse: “And it came to pass, that, as he was praying in a certain place, when he ceased, one of his disciples said unto him, Lord, teach us to pray, as John also taught his disciples.” - Luke 11:1
objective: To have an understanding of what prayer is
INTRODUCTION: Prayer is a dialogue: a two-way communication between one and God through the defined channel: Jesus Christ. Many are still confused about what prayer is and wonder how they can pray. Prayer is communion with our Creator. When we pray, we engage in loving fellowship with our God and Father. He has graciously invited us into a close covenant relationship with Him through Jesus Christ.

DISCUSSION.title: Prayer is an act of communicating with God
Prayer is a two way communication with God. We talk to Him and we listen to hear from Him
Prayer is done privately with our God and Father
Prayer is not vain repetitions but words uttered in faith in our hearts to our God
Prayer is an act of showing our dependency on God
Prayer is the medium of asking for what God alone can give

CONCLUSION: Knowing what prayer is, is very important in these times and seasons. To avoid confusion and enjoy answers to prayers, our knowledge of what prayer is, cannot be overemphasized. When we have the correct understanding we enjoy greater access to the Father

title: PRAYING EFFECTIVELY
subtitle: GATEWAY TO EFFECTIVE PRAYER
memory_verse: “And all things, whatsoever ye shall ask in prayer believing, ye shall receive.” - Matt. 21:22
objective: To discuss some of the prerequisites to effective Prayer.
INTRODUCTION: We must understand that lot of miracles are wrought in the place of prayers; bounds are broken, prisoners are set free, nations are healed etc. It is through prayer that we generate enough power to do great work. There are things we need to know and put in place to enjoy an effective prayer life with results.
Discussion_title: To develop an effective prayer lifestyle, we must:

DISCUSSION.title: Pray as Jesus taught us to pray
Always acknowledge, hallow, adore, extol our Father who is in heaven first and foremost
Desire and pray that His will be done over the matter
Unforgiveness renders prayers ineffective, we must forgive others even as Christ has forgiven us
Persist in the place of prayer
Choose to always retreat before God, having a secret place to seek Him
Possess strong faith in Gods ability to answer our prayers

CONCLUSION: If we want our prayers to be answered, certain steps must be followed.  Only those who follow these steps will have fruits for the labor of their prayers.

title: PRAYING EFFECTIVELY
subtitle: HINDRANCES TO EFFECTIVE PRAYERS
memory_verse: He staggered not at the promise of God through unbelief; but was strong in faith, giving glory to God” – Rom. 4:20
objective: To identify what hinders prayers.
INTRODUCTION: All things answer to prayers offered in the name of Jesus if rightly done. Prayer like every other thing in life has learning features (Luke 11:1). Ignorance of the acceptable ways of prayer can earn us no fruits of prayers. The disciples asked Jesus why they could not cast out the demon.   Therefore, it is important to understand what can hinder prayers.

DISCUSSION.title: God heareth not sinners: but those that does His will

CONCLUSION: The highest effort a believer can waste is prayer effort. The Bible gave us understanding to things that can hinder our prayers. Are you meeting these standard criteria? They are the real hindrance to prayer

title: PRAYING EFFECTIVELY
subtitle: BENEFITS OF EFFECTIVE PRAYER
memory_verse: If you then being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much shall your father who is in heaven give good things to those who ask Him.” - Matt. 7:11.
objective: To highlight the benefits accruable when we engage in effective prayers.
INTRODUCTION: Spending time with God in prayer is one of the most exciting privileges we have as believers. Prayer is the channel of communicating our desires to our maker. Without it, we cannot fully access our needs and desires. The standard of our prayer life determines the benefit and power we gain in praying.

DISCUSSION.title: We gain power to live above sin, Satan and the world
Helps us to receive clear revelation and guidance from God
Have a good understanding of solving problems

CONCLUSION: The effectual fervent prayer of the righteous availeth much. When we pray in the will of God, we receive answers to our prayers and we become encouraged to pray the more. The more we pray according to Gods will, the more effective our prayers become.

title: SPIRITUAL GIFTS
subtitle: INTRODUCTION TO SPIRITUAL GIFTS
memory_verse: For of Him, and through Him, and to Him, are all things: to whom be glory forever. Amen.” - Rom. 11:36
objective: To explain what spiritual gifts are and to identify the source of spiritual gifts.
INTRODUCTION: God is the only source of Spiritual Gifts. He gives the Holy Spirit to those who believe in Jesus Christ. The Holy Spirit is the embodiment of all spiritual gifts and through whom diversities of gifts are given to those who believe in Christ. We must understand that though there are diversities of gifts, operation, and administration, they all emanate from the same source, the Holy Spirit. They are given to profit the body of Christ and not for personal merchandise.

DISCUSSION.title: *They are divine enablement given by the Holy Spirit for the purpose of
Edification of the body of Christ
The source of all spiritual gifts is God

CONCLUSION: Spiritual gifts are numerous and diverse, and they find their origin in Christ who is the Head of all. We must understand that all things come from Him and He gives it to men as He will and as He has predestined from the foundation of the earth. Spiritual gifts are given for specific assignments in the body of Christ.

title: SPIRITUAL GIFTS
subtitle: CATEGORIES OF SPIRITUAL GIFTS
memory_verse: Now there are diversities of gifts but the same Spirit.” I Cor. 12:4
objective: To identify and explain different categories of spiritual gifts.
INTRODUCTION: There are different kinds of spiritual gifts spread across the body of Christ by the Holy Spirit in order to edify and equip the saints with different capabilities.
Discussion_title: Categories of Spiritual Gifts - 1 Cor. 12:8-10

DISCUSSION.title: Prophetic/Revelation Gifts: Prophecy, Interpretation of tongues, Diverse kinds of tongues, Word of wisdom, Word of Knowledge, Discerning of the Spirits.
Power gifts: Faith, Gifts of healing, Working of miracles.

Gifts of Help and Administration
Here, we have church elders, deacons, deaconesses and other workers.

CONCLUSION: Although some spiritual gifts appear more attractive and desirable than others, all the gifts are from the same Spirit of God. Therefore, no spiritual gift should be considered more important than the other.

title: SPIRITUAL GIFTS
subtitle: THE IMPORTANCE OF SPIRITUAL GIFTS
memory_verse: Till we all come in the unity of the faith, and of the knowledge of the Son of God, unto a perfect man, unto the measure of the stature of the stature of the fullness of Christ.” - Eph. 4:13
objective: To examine the roles of Spiritual gifts in the body of Christ.
INTRODUCTION: Different kinds of gifts are distributed to the body of Christ to foster unity and to bring about maturity between the communities of believers. The Christian faith was not designed to be a solitary one but rather a type where we are dependent on one another to function effectively. The Spiritual gifts enable effective functioning of believers when we come together in the place of worship and in the administration of the grace of God that is deposited in our lives.
Discussion_title: The Importance of Spiritual Gifts in the Body of Christ

DISCUSSION.title: For perfecting or building up and maturing the saints
Foster unity in the body of Christ (the church)
The gift is given for the common good of the church. Everybody profit from it
To enable us to occupy till the Lord comes
For Equipping and edifying believers to do the will of God

CONCLUSION: Spiritual gifts are given unto us to foster unity in the body of Christ. It is not given to scatter us nor is it given for endless strive and competition but rather to harmonize the body and present the church without wrinkle at the appearance of our Lord Jesus.

title: SPIRITUAL GIFTS
subtitle: THE ADMINISTRATION OF SPIRITUAL GIFTS
memory_verse: And they of the circumcision which believed were astonished, as many as came with Peter because that on the gentiles also was poured out of the gift of the Holy Ghost.” Acts 10.45
objective: To examine the distribution of the gifts to believers and how it should be used.
INTRODUCTION: The allocation or distribution of Spiritual gifts is done by the Lord Jesus (Eph.4:10-12; 1Cor.12:11). They are given based on the specialization of the assignment given to a man/woman in the body of Christ and his/her local assembly. Each gift is unique and it’s given for a purpose. Having said this, a man can also covet and ask for a particular gift and can so receive for the sole purpose of advancing the Kingdom of God (1Cor.12:32a; 1Cor.14:39 (KJV))
Discussion_title: The Administration of the Spiritual Gifts:

DISCUSSION.title:
With eternity in view
The measure of spiritual gifts that a believer possesses and operates will be unprofitable if at the end the person misses eternal life.

CONCLUSION: The administration of the gifts of the Holy Spirit must have a central focus, which is Jesus and then we must endeavour to see the way He sees things and administer the gifts the way He administers it, with love and without prejudice and condemnation (John 8:10-11).

title: DEATH / BEREAVEMENT
subtitle: UNDERSTANDING DEATH
memory_verse: And as it is appointed unto men once to die, but after this the judgment” - Heb. 9:27
objective: To acquaint us with the mystery surrounding death and bereavement
INTRODUCTION: Death is a unique experience that every mortal must partake of and it will come in its time and way. For many, death arrives as an unwelcome event. The physical changes that signify the dying of a loved one may be difficult to watch. The mental, spiritual and emotional-social adjustments may also be overwhelming most times. This study aims to acquaint us with the mystery surrounding death and bereavement.

DISCUSSION.title: It is usually painful to the bereaved

CONCLUSION: Regardless of how death comes to a man, its intention is to terminate the man's ability to relate/interact with this material world. It also implies that regardless of the great potential embedded in people, their death marks a limit to their expression on earth and time.

title: DEATH / BEREAVEMENT
subtitle: CAUSES OF DEATH
memory_verse: In all of this, Job did not sin by blaming God.” — Job 1:22 NLT
objective: To highlight causes of death.
INTRODUCTION:
There are many factors that could lead to death. Unlike Enoch, not all of us will walk with God until we are physically no more, and except rapture happens, death will be a gateway to eternity. Death is a common denominator to all.
Regardless of this reality, the transition of a loved one will always come with reactions. In all these feelings, God expects His children to act by faith and in hope, especially because we have a God who is Lord even in eternity.
Discussion_title: Causes of Death

DISCUSSION.title: Others: murders, wars, accidents, and natural disasters

CONCLUSION: Death is inevitable, but some of the highlighted causes could be averted by living a disciplined lifestyle. The desirable should be the death at the appointed time.

title: DEATH / BEREAVEMENT
subtitle: PREPARING FOR DEATH
memory_verse: Let not your heart be troubled: ye believe in God, believe also in me.” - John 14:1
objective: To highlight the need for Christians to be in readiness for appointment with death.
INTRODUCTION: It is important for Christians to realize that preparing for death is not tantamount to lack of faith in God. It does not have to be a difficult process as taking right preparatory steps will keep the mind at rest and also ease the minds of the loved ones that would be left behind.

DISCUSSION.title: You may choose where to be buried

CONCLUSION: Death / bereavement and its accompanying sorrows is an obvious reality that everyone must come to terms with. As such, we must be prepared to face it when it comes. However, we must have the knowledge that death should not be feared as it already swallowed in victory. Glory to God!

title: DEATH / BEREAVEMENT
subtitle: HANDLING BEREAVEMENT
memory_verse: Let not your heart be troubled: ye believe in God, believe also in me.” - John 14:1
objective: Wherefore comfort yourselves together, and edify one another, even as also ye do.” – 1Thess. 5:11
INTRODUCTION: The loss of a loved one is life’s most stressful event and can cause a major emotional crisis. After the death of someone you love, you experience bereavement which literally means “to be deprived by death

DISCUSSION.title: It is alright to mourn when bereaved
We must know that death is not final
Our hope transcends this mortal life
Accept that life is for the living

CONCLUSION: Death is only a doorway! For us who believe in Christ, we know that even if we die, we shall live again to die no more. By Jesus' resurrection, we are assured that when we close our eyes in death, we have only transitioned into eternal glory with God!

title: MINISTRY OF ANGELS
subtitle: WHO ARE ANGELS?
memory_verse: Are not all Angels spirits in the divine service, sent to serve for the sake of those who are to inherit salvation?” - Heb. 1:14
objective: To know who Angels are
INTRODUCTION: Angels are spirit beings, created to do the work of the Lord. The Bible says their nature is one of "spirit." of the angels He says, “He makes His angels spirits, and His ministers’ flames of fire” (Heb. 1:7).  In Old Testament the Hebrew word translated "angel" simply means "messenger." It refers to one who brings message, speaks or acts in the place of the one who sent him. The term is mainly used as heavenly messengers.

DISCUSSION.title: Angels are created Beings: They were directly made by the power of God Almighty
Angels are spirit beings who are invisible to the human eye
They are dependent creatures and not God: they wait on God

CONCLUSION: Angels are invisible, spirit beings created by God. These personages have no physical form like humans, but in the past, they have at times assumed a physical form for the sake of humanity. They are sexless, deathless, creatures who are ministering spirits.

title: MINISTRY OF ANGELS
subtitle: UNDERSTANDING THE MINISTRY OF ANGELS
memory_verse: The angel of the Lord encamped around those who fear Him, and He delivers them.” - Psa. 34:7
objective: To highlight the ministry of angels
INTRODUCTION: The Bible presents angels to us as servants of God. This was the point that the angel in Revelation made clear to John when John attempted to worship him (Rev. 22:9). But what do these servants do? What is their purpose?

DISCUSSION.title: Angels listen to God and obey Him
Angels watch over and protect God’s children
Angels carry answers to prayers and messages from God
They are a defense in conflict
They unfold things to come and expand mysteries

CONCLUSION: Angels are always around to establish the word and will of God over your life. You have the responsibility of putting them to work or turning them on in order to fully appropriate their ministrations.

title: MINISTRY OF ANGELS
subtitle: WHAT ANGELS ARE NOT
memory_verse: But to which of the angels said he at any time, Sit on my right hand, until I make thine enemies thy footstool?” – Heb. 1:13
objective: To know who angels are not and their limitations.
INTRODUCTION: The Bible presents angels to us as servants of God. This was the point that the angel in Revelation made clear to John when John attempted to worship him (Rev. 22:9). Having known who they are, it is also important to know who/what they are not.

DISCUSSION.title: Angels are not / equal to God

CONCLUSION: The angels are there for you and the keys to release them have been given. First you acquire knowledge, you build up your confidence with God and then pray them in, command them to action and invoke the arrival with the Name of Jesus.

title: MINISTRY OF ANGELS
subtitle: AVOID GIVING PLACE TO THE DEVIL: THERE ARE FALLEN ANGELS
memory_verse: Lest Satan should get an advantage of us: for we are not ignorant of his devices.” – 2Cor. 2:11
objective: To exercise caution and understand the fact that not all angels are of God.
INTRODUCTION: The subject of angels has made many Christians go astray mainly because of mystifying the reality of angels. Not only can Satan appear as an angel of light but fallen angels can appear as ministers of righteousness.

DISCUSSION.title: Angels are not to be worshipped
Flee from all forms of witchcraft and occultism
Do not put confidence in angels
Fallen angels can appear as ministers of righteousness
Eternal fire is prepared for the devil and his angels

CONCLUSION: We must be on guard and stay alert “lest Satan should get an advantage of us: for we are not ignorant of his devices

title: CHRISTIAN LOVE AND CONFLICT RESOLUTION
subtitle: LOVE: A COMMANDMENT FROM GOD
memory_verse: And this commandment we have from Him: That he who loves God must love his brother also.” - 1John 4:21.
objective: To recognize love as an essential component of Christian Life.
INTRODUCTION: Christian love is a sacrificial and unconditional love (AGAPE LOVE). This is what the heroes of faith had in common (Acts 2:46). God is expecting such from us. It is proof of genuine salvation.
Discussion_title: God loves us first; God's love towards us is intentional and unconditional - Rom 5:8, Jn. 3:16. Christian love must be first productive and fruitful. Love is
CONCLUSION: God has demonstrated His undiluted love towards us, He commanded us to show it towards one another, and by so doing we are fulfilling His commandment.

title: CHRISTIAN LOVE AND CONFLICT RESOLUTION
subtitle: EXAMPLE AND LESSONS OF CHRISTIAN LOVE
memory_verse: For we have great joy and consolation in your love because the hearts of the saints are refreshed by you, brother.” - Phil. 1:7
objective: To identify some characters that demonstrated Love in the Bible.
INTRODUCTION: Christian relationship is life of sacrifice and unconditional love. Below are some of the examples of biblical characters that demonstrated genuine love in which we must emulate.

DISCUSSION.title: Jesus Christ, our perfect example: who laid His life for the benefit of humanity
Priscilla and Aquila with Apollos of Alexandria

CONCLUSION: Now all these things happened unto them for ensamples: and they are written for our admonition, upon whom the ends of the world are come. - 1Cor. 10: 11.

title: CHRISTIAN LOVE AND CONFLICT RESOLUTION
subtitle: HANDLING CONFLICT AMONG BELIEVERS
memory_verse: Strive for peace with everyone, and for the holiness without which no one will see the Lord.” - Heb. 12:14
objective: To identify biblical guidelines on conflict resolution
INTRODUCTION: Every believer needs to learn how to diffuse conflict. Unresolved conflict will damage your ministry and relationship. You can’t be in harmony with God if you’re out of harmony with other people. 1 John 4:20 tells us, “If people say, ‘I love God,’ but hate their brothers or sisters, they are liars” (NCV).
Discussion_title: The steps to resolving conflict in all our relationships.

DISCUSSION.title: Take the initiative in love to make peace; don’t dodge issues rather confront them
Confess your part of the conflict

CONCLUSION: You can have a loving relationship before and during conflict. Due to different personalities or life experiences, you’ll never make it to a complete resolution i.e. agree on everything.  You can disagree without being disagreeable. We need to be peacemakers, though Conflict is everywhere or may never end but we could let the Lord use us to resolve conflict when it arises, this is a decision that honors Jesus.

title: CHRISTIAN LOVE AND CONFLICT RESOLUTION
subtitle: LIVING AT PEACE WITH ALL MEN, OUR CHRISTIAN DUTY
memory_verse: Run from anything that stimulates youthful lusts. Instead, pursue righteous living, faithfulness, love, and peace. Enjoy the companionship of those who call on the Lord with pure hearts. Again I say, don't get involved in foolish, ignorant arguments that only start fights." 2Tim. 2:22-23 (MSG)
objective: To highlight ways to live peacefully in God and with others.
INTRODUCTION: Living in peace is about living harmoniously with yourself, others, and all sentient beings around you. Living in peace is both an outward (a way of life where one respects and loves others in spite of differences) and an inward process (a way of life where one searches the heart and mind and understands the fear that causes impulse for violence). When we continue to ignore the rage within, the storm outside will never subside. However, some basic steps can help us to discover and journey in peace.
Discussion_title: The steps to resolving conflict in all our relationships.

DISCUSSION.title: Seek to love, not to control
Moderate your convictions through the reflection of your thought

CONCLUSION: Living in peace is our obligation so we need to be the change we wish to see in the World. Violence starts with our acceptance of its possibility as a solution. It’s within us as Christians through the strength of Christ to stop violence and become peaceful. At the end of the day, living in peace will be mine and your own conscious choice as our duty prescribes.
